intro: Begonia rubrotincta, commonly known as the red-stained begonia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking, velvety leaves that range in color from dark green to reddish-brown. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Begonia rubrotincta is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its attractive foliage and unique floral display.
